name: Architectural Proficiency Framework
description: A framework defining different levels and areas of expertise in the field of architecture.

DandP.name: Design and Planning
DandP.description: Design and planning competence in architecture and urban development.

facets.name: Architectural Design
facets.description: The art and science of designing buildings and structures.

facets.name: Urban Planning
facets.description: The technical and political process concerned with the development and design of land use.

facets.name: Building Codes and Regulations
facets.description: The set of standards for the construction of buildings to ensure safety and health for the occupants.

facets.name: Sustainable Design
facets.description: Design that seeks to reduce negative impacts on the environment, and the health and comfort of building occupants.

TandC.name: Technical Competence
TandC.description: Technical skills and knowledge in engineering disciplines.

facets.name: Structural Engineering
facets.description: Engineering discipline concerned with the structural integrity and strength of buildings or structures.

facets.name: Building Technology
facets.description: The application of technology to the design and construction of buildings.

facets.name: Material Science
facets.description: The study of the properties and applications of materials of construction or manufacture.

PMandA.name: Project Management and Administration
PMandA.description: Skills and knowledge required for effectively planning, organizing, and administering projects and resources.

facets.name: Project Management
facets.description: The process of leading the work of a team to achieve all project goals within the given constraints.

facets.name: Cost Estimation
facets.description: The approximate prediction of the cost of a program, project, or operation.

facets.name: Risk Management
facets.description: The identification, evaluation, and prioritization of risks followed by coordinated and economical application of resources to minimize, monitor, and control the probability or impact of unfortunate events.

PCandC.name: Professional Communication and Collaboration
PCandC.description: Competence in effectively conveying ideas, engaging in discussions, and collaborating with others in a professional setting.

facets.name: Interpersonal Skills
facets.description: The skills used by a person to interact with others properly.

facets.name: Team Collaboration
facets.description: Working jointly with others, especially in an intellectual endeavor.

facets.name: Leadership
facets.description: The action of leading a group of people or an organization.

competence_levels.name: Novice
competence_levels.description: Individuals at this level are just starting and have no or limited prior experience in the competence area.

competence_levels.name: Intermediate
competence_levels.description: Individuals have a moderate amount of experience and can perform tasks with some guidance.

competence_levels.name: Expert
competence_levels.description: Individuals at this level are highly experienced and can perform tasks independently.
